I already posted pic-its the Andromeda strain biosuit-I am a Respiratory Therapist, Combat Medic from the Army and Navy. Ive worked in ICU, CCU, NeoNatal, onboard a ship and a Field Aid Station. Ive done transplant recovery and had my share of AIDS patients. Ive had my fill of Isolation units-one reason Im getting out of medicine. The Isolation PPE is just wrong for use in a hospital in this case-our best and brightest are being killed because of a stupid design. Its time consuming-it relies on absolute adherence to procedure-which isnt perfect, and mistakes are made. They are hot, and uncomfortable and limit the work that a person can do. You cant take on many patients and still be effective on the floor. I still advocate for a bubble suit-but there are other ideas-Ill talk to some designers here at CSU on some ideas-but it needs to be 1 piece all inclusive-easy to don-easier to get off, cheap, and easy to dispose of. Unless someone want to talk bubble design and how easy that can be to do.

description: Theres pretty good past history of using PFC, just fell out of favor -hard to get better results then being in the best ICU, but what about when your in a makeshift unit ? PFC maybe an alternative to deliver meds-especially hard to deliver such as Riboviran or other large molecualar weight drugs.
summary: I have seen some articles related to Congolese Hemorrhagic fever they used Riboviran , not sure if effective but Riboviran is a pain to work with and deliver-have thought in past using PFC as delivery method to deliver medications thru the pulmonary system.
title: Riboviran
